meanings.definition: Having a single main axis with lateral branches arranged in a single row.
meanings.sent1: The monochasial plant had all its branches neatly lined up in a row.
meanings.sent2: The monochasial flowers bloomed in a straight line along the stem.
meanings.sent3: The monochasial tree looked like a soldier with branches standing at attention.
meanings.sent4: The monochasial arrangement of books on the shelf made it easy to find each one.
meanings.sent5: The monochasial pattern of stars in the sky formed a perfect line of light.

meanings.definition: Arranged in a single row along a central axis.
meanings.sent1: The monochasial beads on the necklace created a simple yet elegant design.
meanings.sent2: The monochasial windows of the building gave it a sleek and modern look.
meanings.sent3: The monochasial arrangement of chairs in the room made it easy for everyone to see the presentation.
meanings.sent4: The monochasial rows of crops in the field stretched out as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent5: The monochasial design of the flagpole made it stand out among the other structures.
